project.teaser: PROMISE aims to create an alliance of photovoltaic excellence through scientific, engineering and research performance within the Maltese research community reliability of existing and emerging module technologies and systems, including the digitalisation aspects for...
project.objective: PROMISE aims to create an alliance of photovoltaic excellence through scientific, engineering and research performance within the Maltese research community reliability of existing and emerging module technologies and systems, including the digitalisation aspects for prediction and optimisation algorithms for innovative solutions to support the energy transition. The Maltese research community, led by the Foundation for Innovation and Research – Malta (FiR) and supported by local technology innovator PIXAM Ltd. will stimulate scientific excellence and sustained collaborations with four world-leading research institutions AIT (Austria), CENER (Spain), CEA (France), and BI Becquerel Institute (Belgium), and Anhalt University of Applied Sciences (Germany) as the leading EU academic applied practice partner. In particular, PROMISE will perform two programmes in research and knowledge considering gender balance, early career researchers and sustainable development goals. The research framework includes a bottom-up approach for a Malta-based research platform on PV reliability, including infrastructure, data collection, analysis and modelling/verification through module test rig, satellite and drone vision technologies and an in-field database of solar module manufacturers. The knowledge gain and transfer framework includes capacity building activities, including a series of workshops, winter/summer schools, training programmes, internships, meetings, mentoring, and research management and administration upskilling. The PROMISE results, lessons learnt, best practices, and success stories will feed a scalability opportunity, extending the research platform to a nationwide/regional landscape while also generating concrete research capacity for a more enabling environment for research in PV reliability in Malta as a solar country and regional energy hub.
project.title: Photovoltaics Reliability Operations and Maintenance Innovative Solutions for Energy Alliance

article.title: Fostering an alliance of photovoltaic research excellence

result.title: D1.2 Data Management Plan - Review
result.description: D1.2 is linked with Task 1.3 Managing Data and includes open access to research data including FAIR data, project data summary, allocation of resources, data security and ethical aspects. D1.2 review is in M15 from D1.1 Plan in M4 and reporting in D1.3 M36 (Report).

result.title: D1.1 Data Management Plan
result.description: D1.1 is linked with Task 1.3 Managing Data and includes open access to research data including FAIR data, project data summary, allocation of resources, data security and ethical aspects. D1.1 will have a review in M15 (Review) and reporting in M36 (Report).

details.authors: Sakshi Sharma; Vibhu Jately; Piyush Kuchhal; Peeyush Kala; Brian Azzopardi

result.title: D3.1 Data collection infrastructure ICT and data base
result.description: D3.1 is linked with Task 3.1:Develop the data collection infrastructure and framework in PV reliability on islands and Task 3.2: Technologies deployment in PV reliability. This deliverable will describe the setting up of the Maltese data collection infrastructure and framework in PV reliability on islands, including open research policies related to and access to the platform. A profile for each test site during the programme is included.

result.title: Performance investigation of state-of-the-art metaheuristic techniques for parameter extraction of solar cells/module

details.authors: Abhishek Sharma; Abhinav Sharma; Moshe Averbukh; Vibhu Jately; Shailendra Rajput; Brian Azzopardi; Wei Hong Lim

result.title: D3.2 Data collection points (PV sites), technologies and monitoring
result.description: D3.2 is linked with Task 3.3: Research Data Collection and Analysis. This deliverable will create the guide for research-based data collection and analysis including system metadata, location and configuration of the PV installation, PV modules data, monitoring data during operation, and maintenance corrective and preventive operations performed. as well as environmental data irradiance (possibly also spectrally resolved or cloud pictures), airborne particles (PM2.5,10) concentration, wind speed and direction, ambient temperature and modules temperature, electrical yield values or even IV-curves fromdetailed measurement. It will form the basis for a research data management system on the topic.

details.authors: Peeyush Kala; Vibhu Jately; Abhinav Sharma; Jyoti Joshi; Brian Azzopardi

result.title: D2.4 Outreach and influence mid-term report
result.description: D2.4 is linked with Task 2.2 Outreach and influencing activities and tools. An outreach and influence report of the implemented communication tools and strategies will be produced as mid-term reported in D2.4 (M18) with a final reporting in (D2.5) M34.

result.title: D4.1 Knowledge programme structure and schedule
result.description: D4.1 is linked with WP4 Knowledge Programme activities. This deliverable will establish the structure and schedule of the whole WP4 activities and programmes.

result.title: D5.1 Research management and administration resources - Review
result.description: D5.1 is linked with Tasks 5.1: Setting up the research management and administration and Task 5.2: Upskilling Training reviews the FiR setup and training received.

result.title: PROMISE: A Knowledge Transfer Platform to Study Reliability in Mediterranean PV Systems

details.authors: Brian Azzopardi, Marcus Rennhofer, Alexandre Mignonac, Ildefonso Muñoz, Carlos Meza, Melodie de l’Epine, Steve Zerafa

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
